page.title: 16MARSTON TRUSSELL LAKE
page.content: On the day chosen,May 9th 1985,the weather was warm and slightly windy. Four accessible 'stations' were chosen on the north bank. At each 'station' we{pond-dipped. To dip, we put the net gently into the water and moved it from side to side for about 1 to 2 minutes. Dips were taken in open water, reeds and mud. Then we took the net out and emptied it inside out into a water-filled bucket. To see what we had, we waited 5 to 10 minutes for the water to clear.{The results of the {dip are shown on the next page. While we were pond-dipping, we made several bird observations and these are also listed with the water specimens.
